references.paper_title: Instance-level relative saliency ranking with graph reasoning
references.reason: This paper is highly relevant because it introduces a graph-based approach to salient object ranking, a core concept that the current paper builds upon and improves.

references.paper_title: Revisiting salient object detection: Simultaneous detection, ranking, and subitizing of multiple salient objects
references.reason: This foundational paper on salient object ranking provides a crucial basis for understanding the problem and evaluating approaches in the field.

references.paper_title: Salient object ranking with position-preserved attention
references.reason: This work introduces the concept of position-preserved attention in salient object ranking, a detail that the current work improves upon for video data.
As one of the pioneering works on video salient object ranking, it lays the groundwork for tackling the challenges of temporal dynamics in video data, which the current paper directly addresses.
This recent paper offers a valuable comparison point, as it proposes an end-to-end solution to video salient object ranking that the current research builds upon and improves.
